source_url.description: Will be used to upload MetadataField's `options`. Cannot be set or used as long as `options` are set.  **Example**: The value is `https://external-url.com/foo/`. In that case `GET` request will be sent to `https://external-url.com/foo/?user_id=uuid1&view_id=uuid1&field_name=bar&view_name=user_view&system_domain_id=uuid1`. Please note that some query parameters were added by *iconik* to get values that were predefined in your system for each user [user_id] and view [view_id]. Metadata field name [field_name], view's name [view_name] and system domain identifier [system_domain_id] will be also passed in each request. *iconik* will successfully parse the response from that URL if it will be sent in JSON formatted string: `{"bar": [{"value": "1", "label": "1st"}, {"value": "2", "label": "2nd"}]}`

Will be used to upload MetadataField's `options`. Cannot be set or used as long as `options` are set.  **Example**: The value is `https://external-url.com/foo/`. In that case `GET` request will be sent to `https://external-url.com/foo/?user_id=uuid1&view_id=uuid1&field_name=bar&view_name=user_view&system_domain_id=uuid1`. 200.description: Returns a metadata values for object and view if it exists

404.description: Metadata values for this object and view doesn't exist

get.summary: Get object metadata by object type, object ID, version ID and view ID

404.description: Metadata values for this object and view doesn't exist

get.summary: Get asset metadata by object type, object ID, version ID and view ID

404.description: Metadata values for this object and view doesn't exist

get.summary: Get asset metadata by object type, object ID and view ID

200.description: Returns a created metadata values for object and view

put.summary: Edit view metadata values for sub-objects of an asset (Such as segments)

parameters.description: The number of items for each page (Default 500)
parameters.name: per_page

parameters.description: If your request returns per_page entries, send the last value of "name" to fetch next page
parameters.name: last_field_name

parameters.description: A comma separated list of fieldnames For example - first_name,last_name,salary
parameters.name: filter

200.description: Returns a list of metadata entities

get.summary: List the fields defined in the system

delete.summary: Delete a particular field by name

200.description: Returns a field

get.summary: Returns a particular field by name

200.description: Returns an updated field
Returns an updated field

post.summary: Create a new metadata field mapping

200.description: Returns the metadata field mapping
Returns a list of metadata field mapping options

get.summary: List the metadata field mapping options

200.description: Returns a list of metadata fields

get.summary: List the fields that can be accessed by a user

200.description: Returns a list of metadata views

get.summary: List the views defined in the system

delete.summary: Delete a particular view by id

200.description: Returns a view

get.summary: Returns a particular view by id

200.description: Returns an updated view
Returns an updated view
Returns metadata categories for an object

409.description: A category with the same name and object_type already exists

post.summary: Add a metadata category for an object type

404.description: Metadata category by object type and category name doesn't exist

delete.summary: Delete metadata category by object type and category name

200.description: Returns metadata category by object type and category name

404.description: Metadata category by object type and category name doesn't exist

get.summary: Get metadata category by object type and category name

200.description: Returns a metadata category

404.description: Metadata category for this object type doesn't exist

put.summary: Edit metadata category for an object type

200.description: Returns metadata views with field for object type and category

404.description: Metadata views with field for object type and category doesn't exist

get.summary: Get metadata views with field for object type and category

put.summary: Edit view metadata values for collection or saved search content.

202.description: Batch metadata update was successfully scheduled

post.summary: Add view metadata values for multiple objects (Assets, Collections or Segments)

202.description: Batch metadata update was successfully scheduled

put.summary: Edit view metadata values for multiple objects (Assets, Collections or Segments)

get.description: This endpoint is available only for admins

parameters.description: Filter out metadata field values, for deleted fields
parameters.name: include_values_for_deleted_fields
